description: A perfect ecosystem for growing delicious tomatoes

temperature.fun_fact: Tomatoes are tropical plants that originated in South America, explaining why they love warmth!

sunlight.fun_fact: Tomato leaves actually turn toward the sun throughout the day like little solar panels!

humidity.warning: High humidity increases risk of fungal diseases

primary.name: Phosphorus (P)
primary.deficiency_signs: Purple tinge on leaves, poor fruit set

nutrients.fun_fact: Tomatoes are heavy feeders and can deplete soil nutrients quickly!

needs.technique: Water at soil level to keep foliage dry

water.fun_fact: Tomato plants are about 95% water themselves!

good_neighbors.benefit: Deter nematodes and other soil pests
Break up soil for tomato roots
Attracts pollinators and deters tomato hornworms

bad_neighbors.problem: Share diseases and compete for nutrients

companions.fun_fact: Tomatoes actually 'talk' to neighboring plants through chemical signals in their roots!

common_pests.name: Tomato Hornworm
common_pests.description: Large green caterpillar with white stripes

common_pests.name: Aphids
common_pests.natural_control: Ladybugs, soapy water spray, neem oil

common_pests.name: Spider Mites
common_pests.description: Tiny spider-like pests that create fine webbing
common_pests.damage: Cause stippling on leaves, plant weakening
common_pests.natural_control: Strong water spray, predatory mites, humidity

common_diseases.name: Early Blight
common_diseases.symptoms: Dark spots with concentric rings on lower leaves
common_diseases.prevention: Mulch, proper spacing, avoid wetting leaves

common_diseases.name: Late Blight
common_diseases.symptoms: Water-soaked spots, white fuzzy growth, rapid death
common_diseases.prevention: Copper fungicide, resistant varieties, good air circulation

common_diseases.name: Blossom End Rot
common_diseases.symptoms: Dark, sunken areas at bottom of fruit

growth_stages.care_tips: Provide 14-16 hours of light, keep soil moist but not wet
Gently shake plants to aid pollination, maintain even moisture
Support heavy fruit with cages or stakes, reduce nitrogen
Reduce watering slightly, harvest when fully colored

harvest_tips.technique: Twist gently or cut with scissors
harvest_tips.fun_fact: A single indeterminate tomato plant can produce 10-15 pounds (4.5-6.8 kg) of fruit in a season!

by_growth_habit.characteristics: Compact, fruits ripen at once, good for containers
Continuous growth and fruiting, needs support

unique_varieties.name: Mortgage Lifter
unique_varieties.flavor_profile: Sweet and meaty with few seeds
unique_varieties.fun_fact: Named because the developer sold enough plants to pay off his mortgage!

gardener_wisdom: Plant deeper than other vegetables - roots will form along the buried stem
Mulch with straw to prevent soil-borne diseases from splashing onto leaves
Prune suckers for larger fruit (indeterminates only)
Rotate planting locations yearly to prevent disease buildup
Save seeds from heirloom varieties for next season's planting
